aws::graph::propositions: # Flight Incident Information
The incident involved a loss of engine power during VFR pattern final approach.
The incident required an emergency descent.
The incident involved an off-field or emergency landing.
The incident involved a collision with terrain or object during landing flare/touchdown.
The loss of engine power was partial.
The loss of engine power was the defining event of the incident.
# Flight Instructor Information
The flight instructor held a Commercial pilot certificate.
The flight instructor held a Flight instructor certificate.
The flight instructor was 25 years old.
The flight instructor was male.
The flight instructor had airplane ratings for single-engine land.
The flight instructor had airplane ratings for multi-engine land.
The flight instructor occupied the right seat.
The flight instructor had no other aircraft ratings.
The flight instructor had an instrument rating for airplane.
A second pilot was present during the incident.
The flight instructor had instructor ratings for airplane single-engine.
The flight instructor had instructor ratings for instrument airplane.
No toxicology was performed on the flight instructor.
The flight instructor held a Class 1 medical certification without waivers or limitations.
The flight instructor's last FAA medical exam was on November 1, 2011.
The flight instructor was an occupational pilot.
The flight instructor's last flight review or equivalent was on April 26, 2012.
The flight instructor had 1322 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 578 total flight hours in this make and model.
The flight instructor had 1262 hours as Pilot In Command in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 227 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 59 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 7 flight hours in the last 24 hours in all aircraft.
# Student Pilot Information
The student pilot held a Student certificate.
The student pilot was 20 years old.
The student pilot was male.
The student pilot had no airplane ratings.
The student pilot occupied the left seat.
The student pilot had no other aircraft ratings.
The student pilot had no instrument ratings.
A second pilot was present during the incident.
The student pilot had no instructor ratings.
No toxicology was performed on the student pilot.
The student pilot held a Class 1 medical certification without waivers or limitations.
The student pilot's last FAA medical exam was on February 28, 2012.
The student pilot was not an occupational pilot.
The student pilot had no recorded last flight review or equivalent.
The student pilot had 27 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The student pilot had 26 total flight hours in this make and model.
The student pilot had 18 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The student pilot had 5 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.

text:
# Factual Information

## History of Flight
| Approach-VFR pattern final | Loss of engine power (partial) (Defining event) |
| Emergency descent | Off-field or emergency landing |
| Landing-flare/touchdown | Collision with terr/obj (non-CFIT) |

## Flight instructor Information
| Certificate: | Commercial; Flight instructor |
| Age: | 25,Male |
| Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land; Multi-engine land |
| Seat Occupied: | Right |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None |
| Restraint Used: |  |
| Instrument Rating(s): | Airplane |
| Second Pilot Present: | Yes |
| Instructor Rating(s): | Airplane single-engine; Instrument airplane |
| Toxicology Performed: | No |
| Medical Certification: | Class 1 Without waivers/limitations |
| Last FAA Medical Exam: | November 1, 2011 |
| Occupational Pilot: | Yes |
| Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | April 26, 2012 |
| Flight Time: | 1322 hours (Total, all aircraft), 578 hours (Total, this make and model), 1262 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 227 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 59 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 7 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft) |

## Student pilot Information
| Certificate: | Student |
| Age: | 20,Male |
| Airplane Rating(s): | None |
| Seat Occupied: | Left |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None |
| Restraint Used: |  |
